results.title: If war should come
results.brief_description: Part of the “History through the newsreel: the 1930s” series which presents extracts from newreels which were shown to the British public during the years 1937 to 1939. Covers Britain’s rearmament plans (1937); Guernica’s collapse in air raids during the Spanish Civil War; Tsingtao falling to the Japanese; the opening of a British Military Base in Singapore; the building of the French Maginot Line; the development of bomb proof shelter; air raid precaution techniques in Australia and England; the development of the Spitfire; the introduction of conscription in April 1939; a civil defence recruiting trailer; and the evacuation of children from Britain’s large cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: If only we'd known
results.brief_description: A series of 3 “trigger” films designed to stimulate discussion, led by a discussion leader. Part 1 - “Debbie and Linda”, concerns a 16 year old schoolgirl who thinks she is pregnant, and turns to her friend Linda, who is expecting a baby. Following this, a doctor is seen interviewing another pregnant teenage girl. Part 2 - “Clinic Talk” - Deborah has just had her pregnancy confirmed - is paying her first visit to the ante-natal clinic. Now, as she waits for her boyfriend she meets Sarah, who is expecting her second child. Part 3 - “Sarah and Eric”. Sarah arrives home from the ante-natal clinic and tells her husband Eric that she has been told to take it easy. Eric persuades her to keep working, as they need the money, and adds that everything was all right when they had their first child.

results.title: Identifying speech disorders: language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, James Craig and Bay State Film Productions
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which portrays a type of deviant communication. It is limited to a descriptive presentation of language disorders which allow the individual instructor to discuss cause, treatment, prognosis etc., according to his own perspective.

results.title: ICI la France: Les Lyceens chez eux
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to the modern Lycee at Enghien where the curriculum includes practical work, a lot of sport and where the pupils can pursue their own chosen activities such as painting as well as participating in the organisation of the school through an elected committee. Several pupils and teachers are introduced and a lesson Ronsard is shown.

results.title: ICI la France: L'heritage de Napoleon
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to Prince Murat, a descendant of Napoleon, who describes Napoleon’s activities as an administrator, and creator of the Civil Code and the Legion d’Honneur. He also founded a boarding school at St Denis for daughters of members of the Legion d’Honneur. A visit to this school shows how the traditions established by Napoleon are still being maintained.

results.title: Icelandic
results.creator_credit: Eric Johnson and Icelandic Freezing Plant Corporation
results.brief_description: The frozen fish industry in Iceland. The ocean conditions that produce Iceland’s fishing grounds; the difficult ocean conditions around Iceland and the life of the fishermen; how the catch is processed; how to cook frozen fish. Also shows Iceland’s stark landscape and how her people depend upon the fishing industry.

results.title: I.A.A.F. track and field events, Helsinki
results.creator_credit: Guy Butler and International Amateur Athletic Federation
results.brief_description: Documentary highlights of the diverse sectors of the Helsinki 1952 Olympic Games ranging from the Opening Ceremony to specific events, ie field, high jump, long jump. Shows respective winners at these events and the lead up to their victory. Silent film with English subtext.

results.title: I Wouldn't Like to Be the Bait
results.brief_description: Take a wonderful journey through the rich and varied fishing areas of South Australia. A geographic presentation gives us not only a tapestry of the best fishing areas, but also a beautifully cinematic vision of the magnificent Southern Coastline. The Murray Valley, Coorong, Eyre and York Peninsulas, and the Spencer and Flinders Gulfs are explored, and sophisticated graphics give both an insight into the best season to fish and the species to be caught in those areas. A summary of the tourist facilities and other attractions is also presented, which makes this program the ideal guide to the coastal and freshwater recreational areas of South Australia.
